pros: Look at it as an entry level job - good training, good incentives to get masters in ABA, good cache value of working at SARRC. Very inclusive atmosphere - people of all sorts of backgrounds working there.
cons: Awful pay - I was paid $7 more per hour elsewhere for a less demanding ABA job. Huge staff turnover because of low pay and being overworked. Work culture wasn't great because everyone complained about the pay and how difficult it all was all the time and nobody stayed long enough to properly be friends with.

review_title: Great company, great people, great benefits... okay pay
pros: An awesome organization that truly cares about the employees and the people it serves. Amazing leadership and management. This company makes you want to be a better person.
cons: The pay is not a livable wage for an RBT with a Bachelors Degree. I understand that they are non-profit, but turnover will always be high because the pay is not enough to keep people there. Even though every other part of the job is perfect.

review_title: Churn and burn atmosphere but the clients are great
pros: Good training program upfront, the clients you work with
cons: Overworked, underpaid, high turnover of staff, not much team building

review_title: Wonderful Organization With  Low Pay and Little Mobility
pros: A truly unique organization with a fantastic work culture. People who work here are genuinely passionate about the Autism community.  A very pleasant and inspiring  environment. Solid employee benefits.
cons: Pay is well below the median for certain job types, even when people have relevant degrees and experience. There is little room for advancing your career here, at least in the research department. The department operates primarily as a revenue source and not as a place to foster long term employment.  Research employees are not given much opportunity to acquire new skills and make themselves more valuable. The department will just hire and train inexperienced staff rather than work with existing staff. This is an unfortunate downside to an otherwise great organization.

job_title: Comprehensive Behavior Interventionist in Phoenix, AZ
pros: SARRC is an amazing place to work as far as the culture of the organization goes. I don’t believe there is another work place or clinic like it. It is full of caring, intelligent individuals who work hard to make a difference. There are great benefits and an amazing employee focus in that sense.
cons: The largest downfall is the pay. It is a nonprofit organization; however, as they begin to increase the pay they have not taken into consideration those who have been there for a certain length of time, who had a higher pay, or who have experience. For example, an employee that has been there 9 months as a Comprehensive Behavior Interventionist 1 (CI1) may receive the same income as new employees with no experience because the starting rate is now the same across CI1s. Advancement has also shown to be variable and unstructured.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Co-workers were friendly.
cons: Owners / Management were not professional at all.  They lie to state authorities and told us what to say.  They have no clue what the state laws are and have no respect for those that tell the truth.  They do everything and anything they want too.

review_title: Great Pay, Great People, Doing Great Things
pros: Great work environment, lots of opportunities for advancement, and the organization really invests in their people.
cons: Only located in AZ currently but they are growing and hope they move to me state soon.

pros: Great clients, great supervisor, BCBA potential, growing field
